title: Gulab Jamun
preparation: In a bowl, mix khoya, all-purpose flour, and baking soda to form a smooth dough; let it rest for 10 minutes.
Shape the dough into small balls, ensuring there are no cracks.
Heat ghee or oil in a deep pan and fry the balls on low heat until golden brown.
In a separate pot, boil sugar and water with cardamom to make a syrup; let it cool slightly.
Soak the fried balls in the warm syrup for at least 2 hours before serving. Enjoy your sweet treat!

title: Biriyani
preparation: Marinate chicken or vegetables in yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, and spices for at least an hour.
Cook basmati rice in salted water until 70% done; drain and set aside.
In a heavy pot, layer half the rice, followed by the marinated mix, then the remaining rice.
Sprinkle fried onions, saffron soaked in warm milk, and fresh herbs over the top.
Seal the pot with a lid or dough to trap steam.
Cook on low heat (dum) for 30-40 minutes until the chicken is tender.
Serve hot with raita and salad.

title: Butter Chicken
preparation: Marinate chicken in yogurt, lemon juice, and spices for at least 30 minutes.
In a pan, melt butter and sauté onions until golden; add ginger-garlic paste.
Add marinated chicken and cook until browned; stir in crushed tomatoes and simmer for 15 minutes.
Pour in heavy cream, adjust seasoning with salt and sugar, and simmer for another 10 minutes.
Garnish with fresh coriander and serve with naan or rice.

title: Palak Panner
preparation: Blanch spinach in boiling water for 2 minutes, then transfer to ice water.
Blend cooled spinach into a smooth puree.
In a pan, heat ghee, sauté cumin seeds, onions, garlic, and ginger until golden.
Add spinach puree, spices, and cook for a few minutes.
Add paneer cubes and simmer gently; stir in cream for richness.
Serve hot with roti or naan.

title: Chole Bhature
preparation: Cook soaked chickpeas with spices until soft.
For bhature, mix flour, yogurt, salt, and water to form a soft dough; let it rest for 30 minutes.
Roll out dough into circles and deep-fry until puffed and golden.
Sauté onions, ginger, garlic, and tomatoes for chole; add cooked chickpeas and simmer.
Serve spicy chole with hot bhature, pickles, and onions.

title: Samosas
preparation: Prepare dough with flour, salt, and water; let it rest for 30 minutes.
Mix boiled potatoes and peas with spices for the filling.
Roll dough into circles, cut in half, and shape into cones.
Fill cones with potato mixture and seal edges with water.
Deep-fry samosas until golden brown and crispy.
Serve with mint chutney or tamarind sauce.

title: Daal Tadka
preparation: Rinse and soak lentils for 30 minutes; cook until soft.
In a pan, heat ghee, add cumin seeds, and sauté onions until golden.
Add garlic, ginger, green chilies, and tomatoes; cook until soft.
Mix in cooked lentils and simmer for 10-15 minutes, adjusting consistency with water.
Garnish with fresh coriander and serve with rice or roti.

title: Pav Bhaji
preparation: Boil and mash mixed vegetables until smooth.
In a pan, heat butter and sauté onions, garlic, and ginger until golden.
Add tomatoes and cook until soft; stir in pav bhaji masala and cook for a few minutes.
Mix in mashed vegetables and simmer, adding water to reach desired consistency.
Toast pav with butter on a skillet until golden.
Serve bhaji hot, garnished with onions, coriander, and a dollop of butter, alongside toasted pav.
